body:
Thanks @dcu 
So i checked to make sure my XCode and OSX is configured correctly.
I can build a normal IOS project in the Simulator & IPhone now
TO make xcode happy with building from bash i had to connect my IPhone and authenticate. Weird, but anyway.
So, i know that OSX is ok with compiling and running xcode ios apps.


The public git repo of the Test Harness project is here:
https://bitbucket.org/gedw99/md-mobile-x

Its just 2 basic files... Could someone try a build on their machine please ?
````
gomobiletest/t-build.sh
````

When i run this on my machine it fails with:
````
x-MacBook-Pro:gomobiletest apple$ ./t-build.sh 
ok  	bitbucket.org/gedw99/md-mobile-x/gomobiletest	0.017s
gomobile: xcrun xcodebuild -configuration Release -project /var/folders/wp/ff6sz9qs6g71jnm12nj2kbyw0000gp/T/gomobile-work-717306326/main.xcodeproj failed: exit status 65
=== BUILD TARGET main OF PROJECT main WITH CONFIGURATION Release ===

Check dependencies
Code Sign error: No matching provisioning profiles found: No provisioning profiles with a valid signing identity (i.e. certificate and private key pair) matching the bundle identifier “org.golang.todo.gomobiletest” were found.

** BUILD FAILED **


The following build commands failed:
	Check dependencies
(1 failure)
````
